p: Paw licking test by inducing formalin was carried out for the study of analgesic activity by using the previously described method [ 44]. The management and treatment of each group ( n = 5) of mice were described in the writhing inhibition test. After 30 min of the administration of sample dose, at the right hind paw of the mice, 20 μL formalin (2.5% v/ v) was injected by using a micro syringe (26-guage needle) at the bottom of the dorsal surface of the skin. The early phase (first 5 min) paw licking and the late phase (15–30 min) paw licking was recorded for the calculation.
